abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Improved Access to Water and Sanitation Services Project for
            Morocco is to provide sustainable access to combined water
            and sewerage services to peri-urban 'quartiers'
            with high levels of 'vulnerable' households. This
            memorandum seeks the approval of the Regional Vice President
            (MNAVP) to extend the closing date of the project by 12
            months from its current closing date of December 31, 2010 to
            December 31, 2011. The performance of the recipients, in
            particular the three implementing operators is satisfactory:
            The project is rated satisfactory for progress towards
            achievement of objective, Overall implementation progress,
            project management, counterpart funding, monitoring and
            evaluation and safeguards. The only change is the extension
            of the closing date of the project by 12 months from its
            current closing date of December 31, 2010 to December 31,
            2011.  The extension is necessary to allow the full
            utilization of the grants. The extension will also give
            ample time to process remaining disbursements, which
            committed their subsidy amount in full in the second and
            third quarters of 2010, respectively. The change does not
            impact the project performance indicators, which remain the
            same. The changes described above do not have a significant
            impact on the original economic, financial, technical,
            institutional or safeguards aspects of the project. The
            Project's development objective remains achievable. The
            extension would give additional time to provide subsidized
            access to services to about 1,870 poor households in the
            Greater Casablanca area, which the remaining subsidy can
            allow connecting under the project.
